    • Method Detail

      • setup

        protected void setup()
              throws ConnectionLostException,
                     java.lang.InterruptedException
        Description copied from class: BaseIOIOLooper
        This method will be called as soon as connection to the IOIO has been established. Typically, this will include opening pins and modules using the openXXX() methods of the BaseIOIOLooper.ioio_ field.
        Overrides:
        setup in class BaseIOIOLooper
        Throws:
        ConnectionLostException - The connection to the IOIO has been lost.
        java.lang.InterruptedException - The thread has been interrupted.

      • loop

        public void loop()
          throws ConnectionLostException
        Description copied from interface: IOIOLooper
        Subclasses should override this method for performing operations to be done repetitively as long as IOIO communication persists. Typically, this will be the main logic of the application, processing inputs and producing outputs.
        Specified by:
        loop in interface IOIOLooper
        Overrides:
        loop in class BaseIOIOLooper
        Throws:
        ConnectionLostException
